content.question: Let f(x) = 6 − x2 . For <math> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo><</mo> <mi>w</mi> <mo><</mo> <msqrt> <mn>6</mn> </msqrt> </mrow> </math>, let A(w) be the area of the triangle formed by the coordinate axes and the line tangent to the graph of f at the point (w, 6 − w2). (a) Find A(1).

frqParts.text: Let f(x) = 6 − x2 . For <math> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo><</mo> <mi>w</mi> <mo><</mo> <msqrt> <mn>6</mn> </msqrt> </mrow> </math>, let A(w) be the area of the triangle formed by the coordinate axes and the line tangent to the graph of f at the point (w, 6 − w2). (a) Find A(1).
(b) For what value of w is A(w) a minimum?

topic.text: 2.2: Defining the Derivative of a Function and Using Derivative Notation

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
